Uses of Class
com.samskivert.io.PersistenceException

Packages that use PersistenceException
com.samskivert.jdbc Provides support services to applications that access relational databases via JDBC. 
com.samskivert.servlet Provides services and patterns that are useful in developing web applications. 
com.samskivert.servlet.user Provides services for managing a database of users in a web application or suite of web applications. 
 

Uses of PersistenceException in com.samskivert.jdbc
 

Methods in com.samskivert.jdbc that throw PersistenceException
static void JDBCUtil.checkedUpdate(PreparedStatement stmt, int expectedCount)
          Calls stmt.executeUpdate() on the supplied statement, checking to see that it returns the expected update count and throwing a persistence exception if it does not.
static void JDBCUtil.checkedUpdate(Statement stmt, String query, int expectedCount)
          Calls stmt.executeUpdate() on the supplied statement with the supplied query, checking to see that it returns the expected update count and throwing a persistence exception if it does not.
abstract  V AutoCloseOperation.cleanInvoke(Connection conn, DatabaseLiaison liason)
          See Repository.Operation.invoke(java.sql.Connection, com.samskivert.jdbc.DatabaseLiaison).

          Clear the transition.

          Obtains a database connection based on the supplied database identifier.
 V Repository.Operation.invoke(Connection conn, DatabaseLiaison liaison)
          Invokes code that performs one or more database operations, all of which will be encapsulated in a single transaction (which can be retried in the event of a transient failure).
 V AutoCloseOperation.invoke(Connection conn, DatabaseLiaison liaison)
          Invokes AutoCloseOperation.cleanInvoke(java.sql.Connection, com.samskivert.jdbc.DatabaseLiaison) and then closes any statements opened by that call.

          Returns whether the specified name transition been applied.

          Perform a transition if it has not already been applied, and record that it was applied.

Constructors in com.samskivert.servlet that throw PersistenceException
JDBCTableSiteIdentifier(ConnectionProvider conprov)

JDBCTableSiteIdentifier(ConnectionProvider conprov, int defaultSiteId)
          Creates an identifier that will load data from the supplied connection provider and which will use the supplied default site id instead of SiteIdentifier.DEFAULT_SITE_ID.

Subclasses of PersistenceException in com.samskivert.servlet.user
 class UserExistsException
          Thrown during user account creation when a user with the requested username already exists.
